alert.note: Alert for Coastal Del Norte; Northern Humboldt Coast; Southwestern Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued April 05 at 6:19AM PDT until April 05 at 12:00PM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PDT TODAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves up to 23 feet. * WHERE...Coastal Del Norte, Northern Humboldt Coast and Southwestern Humboldt Counties. * WHEN...Until noon PDT today. * IMPACTS...Dangerous surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Beachcombing is highly discouraged!
info.instruction: Large breaking waves along the coast will lead to increased wave run-up on beaches with waves topping and washing over large rocks and jetties. These large waves can be erratic and unpredictable. Use extra caution near the surf zone as these large waves will be capable of sweeping people into the frigid and turbulent ocean water. Mariners traversing the bar are urged to exercise extreme caution or stay in port until the threat subsides. Please contact the U.S. Coast Guard for information regarding harbor and bar closures.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Del Norte; Northern Humboldt Coast; Southwestern Humboldt
